content:
I'd be happy to help! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have real-time access to specific location information, including sunrise and sunset times. Sunrise times vary depending on your location, time zone, and time of year.

But you can easily find the sunrise time for your location online. Here are a few options:

1. Google search: Simply type "sunrise time [your city/state]" or "sunrise time [your zip code]" in Google, and it will show you the sunrise time for your location.
2. Weather websites: Many weather websites, such as weather.com or accuweather.com, provide sunrise and sunset times for specific locations.
3. Sunrise/sunset apps: You can download apps like Sunrise Sunset Times or The Photographer's Ephemeris, which can provide you with sunrise and sunset times for your location.

Just enter your location, and you'll get the sunrise time for Saturday. Don't forget to double-check the time zone and adjust accordingly.
